This feature, first tested in mid-2023, automatically generates dubbed versions of videos in multiple languages at upload: if a video is originally in English, it can be dubbed into French, German, Hindi, Italian, Spanish, Indonesian, Japanese, and Portuguese; for videos starting in one of those languages, only English dubs are produced. Creators can preview these dubs before publishing and have the option to unpublish or delete them. While current dubs may sound unnatural, YouTube aims to improve tone, emotion, and ambiance in future updates. The company acknowledges potential imperfections in the translations and voice representation but is actively working on enhancing accuracy. It allows creators to automatically dub and lip-sync their videos into another language, facilitating better global reach and accessibility. According to Meta, the feature is free and helps users connect with international audiences more effectively by delivering content in the viewer's native language. response_text: Here are some free AI tools that can help translate your videos (subtitles + audio/dubbing options):  ⟶ Free options you can try  CapCut AI Video Translator – auto-generates and translates subtitles for free online. CapCut [https://www.capcut.com/tools/video-translator/]  Canva AI Video Translator – translates and dubs videos with AI in many languages. Canva [https://www.canva.com/features/ai-video-translator/]  Invideo AI Video Translator – supports translation and AI voice in 50+ languages with a free tier. Invideo [https://invideo.io/make/video-translator/]  Wayin.ai Video Translator – instantly transcribes and translates subtitles into 100+ languages. WayinVideo [https://wayin.ai/tools/video-translator/]  Vidnoz AI Video Translator – free online translator with support for ~140 languages. Vidnoz [https://www.vidnoz.com/video-translate.html]  Happy Scribe (first 10 min free) – subtitle/transcript translation for video. HappyScribe [https://www.happyscribe.com/translate-video]  ScreenPal AI Video Translator – adds translated captions and voiceovers for free. screenpal.com [https://screenpal.com/tool/ai-video-translator]  Tools with free trial/demo  Rask AI – AI transcription/translation + lip sync, supports long videos. rask.ai [https://www.rask.ai/]  BlipCut AI Video Translator – free access with voice cloning & subtitle features. videotranslator.blipcut.com [https://videotranslator.blipcut.com/]  Notes  Some offer free usage forever (like CapCut/Canva for basic subtitles) while others give a free trial or limited minutes before paid plans kick in. CapCut+1 [https://www.capcut.com/tools/video-translator/]  If you just need subtitles (no dubbing), CapCut or Wayin are simplest. For dubbing with voices, try Canva or BlipCut first. CapCut+1 [https://www.capcut.com/tools/video-translator/]  Want me to recommend the best one for YouTube specifically?
